intro: Pleomele hewittii, commonly known as the Kauri fig, is a striking evergreen shrub or small tree native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. The plant produces edible berries that are an important food source for native birds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in coastal and lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
